item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

You can’t have two else statements to one if…

item.title: ~~# Something has gone wrong! #~~
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

Now I’ve this error:

.\src\client.java:66: 'else' without 'if' } else { ^ .\src\misc.java:4: expected import.java.util.Calendar; ^ .\src\misc.java:5: expected import.java.GregorianCalendar; ^ 3 errors

Here’s the code:

// Source made by Djdoyle1 (Jordan) import java.io.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import java.util.Calendar; import java.util.GregorianCalendar;

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {
public int teleDelay;
public int teleport;
public int chosenNumber;
public int computerNumber;
public int timeSinceLotto;
public int winnings;
public int played;
public int serverOnlineTime;
public int millisecondsToSeconds;
public void teleport() {
if(teleport == 1) {
if(misc.random(5) == 3) {
sendMessage(“There is a glitch in the teleportation system.”);
teleportToX = 2338;
teleportToY = 4747;
sendMessage(“Click around to get home!”);
teleport = 0;
}
}
}
public void lotto() {
if (playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000) == true) { // do they have 100k?
chosenNumber = misc.random(4);
computerNumber = misc.random(4);
if(timeSinceLotto == 0) { // 12 hours…
played = 1;
misc.deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);
misc.sendMessage(“Your Number is: “+chosenNumber+”, the computers number is: “+computerNumber);
misc.println(”[LOTTO]: “+playerName+”'s number is: “+chosenNumber+”, computers number is: “+computerNumber);
if(chosenNumber == computerNumber) {
misc.println(”[LOTTO]: “+playerName+” won!”);
misc.sendMessage(“You win?!”);
if(winnings <= 3) {
misc.sendMessage(“Winnings: 1m”);
misc.addItem(995, 1000000);
} else {
misc.sendMessage(“It’s your lucky day! - Lucky Dip Time!”);
if(misc.random(3) == 3) {
misc.addItem(5703, 1);
misc.sendMessage(“DDS!”);
} else if(misc.random(3) == 2) {
misc.addItem(995, 3000000);
misc.sendMessage(“3 million!”);
} else if(misc.random(3) == 1) {
misc.addItem(1375, 1);
misc.sendMessage(“Dragon Battle Axe!”);
} else if(misc.random(3) == 0) {
misc.addItem(2365, 1);
misc.sendMessage(“Rare gold bar!!”);
}
}
} else {
misc.println("[LOTTO]: “+playerName+” lost! One more bit of winnings will be put onto the next lotto toss.");
misc.sendMessage(“You lost, One more bit of winnings will be put onto the next lotto toss.”);
winnings += 1;
}
} else {
misc.sendMessage(“You’ve already done the lotto in 12 hours!”);
} else {
misc.sendMessage(“Sowwie! You don’t have 100k!”);
}
}
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: ~~# Something has gone wrong! #~~
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

You’re starting an if-statement in the middle of the class; it isn’t even in a method.

Read full topic

item.title: ~~# Something has gone wrong! #~~
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

if (teleport == 1) {

Try that and if it doesn’t work, could you show me what’s in the code after the opening bracket?

item.title: ~~# Something has gone wrong! #~~
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

Okay, something has gone wrong, I’m coding a server (from scratch) but something has gone wrong!

.\src\client.java:7: illegal start of type public class client extends Player implements { ^ .\src\client.java:17: illegal start of type if(teleport == 1) { ^ .\src\client.java:17: expected if(teleport == 1) { ^ .\src\client.java:17: ';' expected if(teleport == 1) { ^ .\src\client.java:17: illegal start of type if(teleport == 1) { ^ .\src\client.java:17: expected if(teleport == 1) { ^ .\src\client.java:17: ';' expected if(teleport == 1) { ^ .\src\client.java:18: illegal start of type if(misc.random(5) == 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:18: ';' expected if(misc.random(5) == 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:18: invalid method declaration; return type required if(misc.random(5) == 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:18: illegal start of type if(misc.random(5) == 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:18: ';' expected if(misc.random(5) == 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:26: class, interface, or enum expected public void lotto() { ^ .\src\client.java:29: class, interface, or enum expected computerNumber = misc.random(4); ^ .\src\client.java:30: class, interface, or enum expected if(timeSinceLotto == 0) { // 12 hours... ^ .\src\client.java:32: class, interface, or enum expected misc.deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000); ^ .\src\client.java:33: class, interface, or enum expected misc.sendMessage("Your Number is: "+chosenNumber +", the computers number is: "+computerNumber); ^ .\src\client.java:34: class, interface, or enum expected misc.println("[LOTTO]: "+playerName+"'s number i s: "+chosenNumber+", computers number is: "+computerNumber); ^ .\src\client.java:35: class, interface, or enum expected if(chosenNumber == computerNumber) { ^ .\src\client.java:37: class, interface, or enum expected misc.sendMessage("You win?!"); ^ .\src\client.java:38: class, interface, or enum expected if(winnings <= 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:40: class, interface, or enum expected misc.addItem(995, 1000000); ^ .\src\client.java:41: class, interface, or enum expected } else { ^ .\src\client.java:43: class, interface, or enum expected if(misc.random(3) == 3) { ^ .\src\client.java:45: class, interface, or enum expected misc.sendMessage("DDS!") ; ^ .\src\client.java:46: class, interface, or enum expected } else if(misc.random(3) == 2) { 
                                            ^

.\src\client.java:48: class, interface, or enum expected
misc.sendMessage(“3 mill
ion!”);
^
.\src\client.java:49: class, interface, or enum expected
} else if(misc.random(3) == 1) {

                                            ^

.\src\client.java:51: class, interface, or enum expected
misc.sendMessage(“Dragon
Battle Axe!”);
^
.\src\client.java:52: class, interface, or enum expected
} else if(misc.random(3) == 0) {

                                            ^

.\src\client.java:54: class, interface, or enum expected
misc.sendMessage(“Rare g
old bar!!”);
^
.\src\client.java:55: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^
.\src\client.java:59: class, interface, or enum expected
misc.sendMessage(“You lost, One
more bit of winnings will be put onto the next lotto toss.”);
^
.\src\client.java:60: class, interface, or enum expected
winnings += 1;
^
.\src\client.java:61: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^
.\src\client.java:64: class, interface, or enum expected
} else {
^
.\src\client.java:66: class, interface, or enum expected
}
^
.\src\misc.java:4: expected
import.java.util.Calendar;
^
.\src\misc.java:5: expected
import.java.GregorianCalendar;
^
39 errors

I’ll show you all the files that the errors seem to be coming from…
Misc:

// Misc class import java.io.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import.java.util.Calendar; import.java.GregorianCalendar;

public class misc {
public boolean addItem(int item, int amount) {
if (item == -1) {
return false;
}
if (!Item.itemStackable[item] || amount < 1) {
amount = 1;
}

    if ((freeSlots() >= amount && !Item.itemStackable[item])
            || freeSlots() > 0) {
        for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
            if (playerItems[i] == (item + 1) && Item.itemStackable[item]
                    && playerItems[i] > 0) {
                playerItems[i] = (item + 1);
                if ((playerItemsN[i] + amount) < maxItemAmount
                        && (playerItemsN[i] + amount) > -1) {
                    playerItemsN[i] += amount;
                } else {
                    playerItemsN[i] = maxItemAmount;
                }
                outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
                outStream.writeWord(3214);
                outStream.writeByte(i);
                outStream.writeWord(playerItems[i]);
                if (playerItemsN[i] > 254) {
                    outStream.writeByte(255);
                    outStream.writeDWord(playerItemsN[i]);
                } else {
                    outStream.writeByte(playerItemsN[i]); // amount	
                }
                outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
                i = 30;
                return true;
            }
        }
        for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
            if (playerItems[i] <= 0) {
                playerItems[i] = item + 1;
                if (amount < maxItemAmount && amount > -1) {
                    playerItemsN[i] = amount;
                } else {
                    playerItemsN[i] = maxItemAmount;
                }
                outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
                outStream.writeWord(3214);
                outStream.writeByte(i);
                outStream.writeWord(playerItems[i]);
                if (playerItemsN[i] > 254) {
                    outStream.writeByte(255);
                    outStream.writeDWord(playerItemsN[i]);
                } else {
                    outStream.writeByte(playerItemsN[i]); // amount	
                }
                outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
                i = 30;
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    } else {
        sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory.");
        return false;
    }
}
public boolean deleteItem(int id, int slot, int amount) {
    if (slot > -1 && slot < playerItems.length) {
        if ((playerItems[slot] - 1) == id) {
            if (playerItemsN[slot] > amount) {
                playerItemsN[slot] -= amount;
            } else {
                playerItemsN[slot] = 0;
                playerItems[slot] = 0;
            }
            resetItems(3214);
            return true;
        }
    } else {
        return false;
    }
    return false;
}
public void sendMessage(String s) {
    outStream.createFrameVarSize(253);
    outStream.writeString(s);
    outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}

public static int random(int range) { // 0 till range
    return (int) (java.lang.Math.random() * range);
}
public static void println(String str) {
    System.out.println(str);
}

}


Client:
// Source made by Djdoyle1 (Jordan)
import java.io.*;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;

public class client extends Player implements {
public int teleDelay;
public int teleport;
public int chosenNumber;
public int computerNumber;
public int timeSinceLotto;
public int winnings;
public int played;
public int serverOnlineTime;
public int millisecondsToSeconds;
if(teleport == 1) {
if(misc.random(5) == 3) {
sendMessage(“There is a glitch in the teleportation system.”);
teleportToX = 2338;
teleportToY = 4747;
sendMessage(“Click around to get home!”);
teleport = 0;
}
}
public void lotto() {
if (playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000) == true) { // do they have 100k?
chosenNumber = misc.random(4);
computerNumber = misc.random(4);
if(timeSinceLotto == 0) { // 12 hours…
played = 1;
misc.deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);
misc.sendMessage(“Your Number is: “+chosenNumber+”, the computers number is: “+computerNumber);
misc.println(”[LOTTO]: “+playerName+”'s number is: “+chosenNumber+”, computers number is: “+computerNumber);
if(chosenNumber == computerNumber) {
misc.println(”[LOTTO]: “+playerName+” won!”);
misc.sendMessage(“You win?!”);
if(winnings <= 3) {
misc.sendMessage(“Winnings: 1m”);
misc.addItem(995, 1000000);
} else {
misc.sendMessage(“It’s your lucky day! - Lucky Dip Time!”);
if(misc.random(3) == 3) {
misc.addItem(5703, 1);
misc.sendMessage(“DDS!”);
} else if(misc.random(3) == 2) {
misc.addItem(995, 3000000);
misc.sendMessage(“3 million!”);
} else if(misc.random(3) == 1) {
misc.addItem(1375, 1);
misc.sendMessage(“Dragon Battle Axe!”);
} else if(misc.random(3) == 0) {
misc.addItem(2365, 1);
misc.sendMessage(“Rare gold bar!!”);
}
}
} else {
misc.println("[LOTTO]: “+playerName+” lost! One more bit of winnings will be put onto the next lotto toss.");
misc.sendMessage(“You lost, One more bit of winnings will be put onto the next lotto toss.”);
winnings += 1;
}
} else {
misc.sendMessage(“You’ve already done the lotto in 12 hours!”);
} else {
misc.sendMessage(“Sowwie! You don’t have 100k!”);
}
}
}
[/quote]
